nodes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
@dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: transferOwnership
balanceOf
allowance
burn
transfer

approve

nodes.documentation:
@dev Function to stop minting new tokens.
@return True if the operation was successful.
nodes.name: finishMinting
TokenPurchase

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

params._owner: address The address which owns the funds.
params._spender: address The address which will spend the funds.

allowance(address,address).return: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender.  * Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

params._owner: The address of the owner which allows tokens to a spender
params._spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params._value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params._owner: The address to query the the balance of.

balanceOf(address).return: An uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

burn(address,uint256).details: Burns the tokens of the specified address.

decreaseApproval(address,address,uint256.details: Decrease the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.      * approve should be called when allowed[_spender] == 0. To decrement allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol

params._owner: The address of the owner which allows tokens to a spender
params._spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params._subtractedValue: The amount of tokens to decrease the allowance by.

finishMinting().details: Function to stop minting new tokens.
finishMinting().return: True if the operation was successful.

increaseApproval(address,address,uint256.details: Increase the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.      * approve should be called when allowed[_spender] == 0. To increment allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol

params._addedValue: The amount of tokens to increase the allowance by.
params._owner: The address of the owner which allows tokens to a spender
params._spender: The address which will spend the funds.

transfer(address,uint256).details: transfer token for a specified address

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfer tokens from one address to another

params._from: address The address which you want to send tokens from
params._to: address The address which you want to transfer to
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.
